Development: Partly based on the ath9k driver for Linux

Original/Primary developer: Antti Kantee,{{cite web|url= was contracted to write a driver for the Intel 3160/726x wireless chips, a driver which became iwm(4)|publisher=beastie.pl|date=2015-10-14|accessdate=2016-02-21|archive-url= Stefan Sperling
Development: Based on iwn, and iwlwifi driver released by Intel for Linux under dual GPLv2/BSD license
Based on source code released by Atheros for Linux under the ISC

Chipset: Conexant/Intersil Prism GT Full-MAC ISL3877, ISL3880, and ISL3890 chips
Ralink RT2500, RT2501, RT2600, RT2700, RT2800, RT3090, RT3292, RT3592 and RT5390 (ral), RT2500USB (ural)
Lucent Hermes (WaveLAN/ ORiNOCO), Intersil PRISM-2, PRISM-2.5, PRISM-3, Symbol Spectrum24
Free firmware: Yes for Spectrum24 and N/A for others

Driver: wpiThere is more details about the port at kerneltrap
